column4: When I return home from work, my laptop is set to "Roaming".  No big deal, I switch to "Home" via NetworkManager's applet interface.
Then my connection dies after a random number of seconds.
Everything shows up fine.
IP is set to static one, mii-diag shows everything is working, but no data goes through.
When I switch back to DHCP, it starts again.
but I wasn't able to set the static IP by any means once after my laptop starts with a DHCP address.
nothing is being neither sent neither received, to the best of my knowledge.
I've tried disabling avahi daemon, didn't help
it wasn't the culprit
so my question is then: where can I start to tinker in order to diagnose my network problem?  I'm not all too well familiar with networking.
test if you can ping, make sure something is in /etc/resolve.conf, ifconfig gives info, try ifdown and ifup for your connection. apt-get remove avahi-daemon
nope, yes, yes, doesn't work
I disable avahi-daemon by hand: /etc/init.d/avahi stop
tried a different cord?
its worked before though right?
I think this started to happen at some point, I'm not quite sure
anything on dmesg? is your card claimed on lshw?
I tail -f my syslog at the time when my connection stops working -- NOTHING there
so its working now?
probably your router, I had some trouble with mine
actually it works with Windows quite well, and I've changed routers in the meantine
trying using wireshark for a while plugged into your router offline, log any oddities
if all else fails that is
